Please help us welcome Marie Dillon to the #SpectrumSting team! Read below for a brief introduction from Miss Dillion:

Hello! My name is Marie Dillon, and I teach Language Arts here at Spectrum. I grew up on a farm in Zimmerman, MN, and I was part of the very first graduating class of Spectrum High School. I earned a Bachelor’s degree in English with a minor in Psychology and a Master’s degree in English with a concentration in Composition, both from NDSU (North Dakota State University) in Fargo, North Dakota. I also taught college level Composition classes while I was earning my Master’s degree at NDSU.

I am currently working on writing my thesis to earn a second Master’s degree in Teaching, from Bethel University. I collect fountain pens, and in my free time, I enjoy reading, writing, and crocheting.

On September 8 the #SpectrumSting boys soccer team traveled to Hugo for a conference match with North Lakes Academy and came home with a 6-0 win. The Sting came out strong with dominant ball possession and upfield pressure. Senior captain Dylan Smith got Spectrum on the board early with one of his two first half goals. Entering the second half with a 4-0 lead, the Sting were determined to keep North Lakes on their heels.

Other Sting goals came from Connor Bakken, Alex Frischholz, Thomas DeBoer and Judah Rogers. The goal keeping duties were split by Jacob Demond and John Sweet, who combined to stop four shots and shared the shutout.

With their season record now even at 1-1, Spectrum will host a strong Eagle Ridge Academy team on Sept. 11. Game time is 4:15 pm at the Spectrum Athletic Complex.

On Saturday, August 29 the #SpectrumSting girls soccer team played their first game of the season at home against Mounds Park Academy (MPA). The teams were evenly matched and ended with a final score of 1-1.

MPA scored first with a low shot just out of the reach of goal keeper Sophie Brenteson. Senior Captain Addie Westermeyer found the back of the net with a hard shot that was assisted by Freshman Etta Glinsek. The Sting also had several good shots just wide of the goal.

"The girls played hard, but couldn't quite find the spot", said coach Dana Gibson. "We had very strong play by some young new talent from Freshman Maddie Fritel and Sophomore Grace Beck. Also, excellent defense by 8th Grader Ella Lynch and 7th Grader Maggie Novotny".

The Spectrum girls will host Hope Academy on Wednesday, Sept. 2 at 4:30 pm.

We’re a bit late in posting, but this great accomplishment took place before the school closure and we just had to share! 😊

In early March, Grade 6 Bare Necessities Service Learning learned about local food instability and decided to support our local food shelf with a change war.

Students promoted the friendly competition between Sting advisories in the Grade 6 building by designing posters, writing and giving announcements, and encouraging participation. Mr. Frentzos' advisory took first and had donuts during advisory time on March 13. Mrs. Johnson delivered a cashier's check to CAER (Community Aid Elk RIver) the following week, in the amount of $368.10. This equals $3,681 in buying power for CAER to use with its regional food bank.

Well done, #SpectrumSting sixth graders!
